Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc31
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.view.tui

Class TUI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.view.UI
it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.view.tui.TUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
ShowUpdate
public class TUI extends UI
Text User Interface class that manages the text interface of the game

    Receives the play areas and the achieved resources of all the players, selects the correct ones checking the activePlayArea and creates the corresponding StringBuilder.
    void
    show_playerTurn(String username, String info)
    Receives the username of the player and the player info about is PlayerState If the username is the same as the client's username: constructs the corresponding StringBuilder and sends it to the playViewTHREAD adding it to the playViewUpdateLOCK queue; calls notify on the playViewUpdateLOCK queue to print the new play view updates; updates the corresponding areasCache with the new player state.
    void
    show_privateChatMessage(String fromUsername, String toUsername, String message)
    Update the chatMessages queue with a private message only if the message is for the client or from the client.

    show_readyStatus(String username, boolean status)

    • playAreaAllPlayers

      private Map<String,StringBuilder> playAreaAllPlayers

    • activePlayArea

      private String activePlayArea
      String that contains username of the owner of the playArea to be printed

    • areasCache

      Map<TUIareas,StringBuilder> areasCache
      Map that associates a TUIareas with a StringBuilder containing the last received representation of that area

    • state

      private TUIstate state
      State of the TUI (State Design Pattern)

      This variable is used to manage the available commands in the current state

    • stateLOCK

      protected Object stateLOCK
      Object used to synchronize the state commands execute by the cmdLineProcessTHREAD and the cmdLineReaderTHREAD. Together with the stateLockQueueLOCK are used to manage issues arising from improper calls to a blocking input acquisition of a Scanner object. input.

      This lock ensures that only one thread can perform a blocking input operation on the Scanner at a time, preventing potential conflicts and ensuring that the input is handled safely and correctly.

    • stateLockQueueLOCK

      protected Queue<Integer> stateLockQueueLOCK
      Object used to synchronize the state commands execute by the cmdLineProcessTHREAD and the cmdLineReaderTHREAD. Together with the stateLOCK are used to manage issues arising from improper calls to a blocking input acquisition of a Scanner object. input.

      This lock ensures that only one thread can perform a blocking input operation on the Scanner at a time, preventing potential conflicts and ensuring that the input is handled safely and correctly.

    • cmdLineAreaSelectionLOCK

      private volatile Queue<Integer> cmdLineAreaSelectionLOCK
      This variable is used to manage the TUI active area selection. Each TUI area has its own Scanner object to read the input. If this queue is not empty, the selected area is the command line input area.

    • chatAreaSelectionLOCK

      private volatile Queue<Integer> chatAreaSelectionLOCK
      This variable is used to manage the chat active area selection. Each TUI area has its own Scanner object to read the input. If this queue is not empty, the selected area is the chat input area.

    • chatNeedsUpdateLOCK

      private Object chatNeedsUpdateLOCK
      This variable is used to manage the chat board avoiding to update it every time. Each time a chat needs to be updated, a notify on this lock is called.

    • comingFromChat

      private volatile boolean comingFromChat
      This variable is used to inform the cmdLineReaderTHREAD that the previously active area was the chat input area. In that case the thread do not wait a command to call TUIstate.stateNotify() to get the input again because no command that needs input is executing at the moment.

    • chatMessages

      private Queue<String> chatMessages
      This variable is used to manage the chat messages. The server object NewChatMessage, depending on the way the GameController constructs it, calls the TUI method show_chatMessage(String, String) that adds a formatted String (username: message), or show_privateChatMessage(String, String, String) that adds only for the specified client's tui a formatted String ("[From " username"]": message) to this queue.

      The chatBoardThread access this queue to print the messages.

    • cmdLineOutLOCK

      private final Queue<String> cmdLineOutLOCK
      This variable is used to manage the command line output messages.

      Instead of printing the messages directly to the system output, each message to be printed by the tui must be added to this queue.

      The cmdLineOutTHREAD thread will print them to the right position of the console.

    • cmdLineMessagesLOCK

      protected final Queue<String> cmdLineMessagesLOCK
      This variable is used to manage the command line input messages.

      The cmdLineReaderTHREAD reads the input from the system input and adds it to this queue.

      The cmdLineProcessTHREAD reads the messages from this queue and processes them.

    • playViewUpdateLOCK

      private final Queue<StringBuilder> playViewUpdateLOCK
      This queue is used to manage the play area update.

      The playViewTHREAD take the play view updates to print from this queue.

    • cmdLineProcessTHREAD

      Thread cmdLineProcessTHREAD
      This thread is used to process the commands in the cmdLineMessagesLOCK queue. This threads waits on the cmdLineMessagesLOCK queue if contains no elements. Each new elements added to the queue wakes up the thread.

      The commands are processed by the execute_command(String) method.

      The thread is started by the cmdLineReaderTHREAD.

    • chatNotification

      private volatile boolean chatNotification
      Indicates if the statusBarTHREAD has already printed the chat notification

    • newChatMessage

      private volatile boolean newChatMessage
      Indicates if there is a new chat message

    • heartBeatReceived

      private volatile boolean heartBeatReceived
      Indicates if the heart beat is still being received

    • HBprinted

      private volatile boolean HBprinted
      Indicates if the statusBarTHREAD has already printed the heart beat

    • statusBarLOCK

      private final Object statusBarLOCK
      This object is used to synchronize the status bar thread and the main thread.

    • statusBarTHREAD

      Thread statusBarTHREAD
      This thread is used to print the heart beat status and the chat notification.

      When it starts, it prints the heart beat disconnected status and waits for the statusBarLOCK object.

      If the heart beat is not received, it prints the heart beat disconnected. The heart beat is received by the show_heartBeat() method that sets the heartBeatReceived boolean to true. show_heartBeat() also prints the status only if the heart beat is not already printed checking the HBprinted boolean.

      The same happens for the chat notification. The chat notification is received by the show_chatMessage(String, String) or show_privateChatMessage(String, String, String) methods that sets the newChatMessage boolean to true. The chat notification is printed only if the chatNotification is false.

    • timerTHREAD

      Thread timerTHREAD
      This thread is used to update the status bar every DV.clientHBUpdate

    • cmdLineReaderTHREAD

      Thread cmdLineReaderTHREAD
      Thread responsible for reading user-executable TUIstateCommands typed by the user.
      • It starts the cmdLineProcessTHREAD
      Sends the input to the cmdLineProcessTHREAD and waits for the command to be executed to get the input again.

      Locks description:

      • cmdLineAreaSelectionLOCK blocks the current thread if the TUI cursor is not in the cmdLineArea
      • stateLOCK and stateLockQueueLOCK blocks the current thread if TUIstate.stateNotify() has not been called. Two locks are used to ensure that the stateNotify() terminate its execution unblocking the cmdLineReader only when stateLockQueue in not empty meaning it's waiting.
      This Thread also catches the "chat" input to switch to the chat input area. Switching to the chat input area it erase the chat notification and updates the booleans chatNotification and newChatMessage to false.

    • cmdLineOutTHREAD

      Thread cmdLineOutTHREAD
      This thread is used to print the command line output messages the right way and in the right position. It starts the cmdLineReaderTHREAD to get the input. It synchronizes on the cmdLineOutLOCK object to wait for the messages to be updated.

    • chatBoardThread

      Thread chatBoardThread
      This thread is used to print the chat board messages the right way and in the right position. It synchronizes on the chatNeedsUpdateLOCK object to wait for the chat messages to be updated.

    • chatReaderTHREAD

      Thread chatReaderTHREAD
      This thread handle the chat input.

      It waits on the chatAreaSelectionLOCK queue if it is empty. Each new element added to the queue wakes up the thread. Based on the input, it calls the corresponding client method to construct the correct ChatMessageObj.

      See Also:
      • ClientCommands.sendChatMessage(String, String)
      • ClientCommands.sendChatMessage(String, String, String)

    • playViewTHREAD

      Thread playViewTHREAD
      This thread is used to print the play view updates as soon as they are available.

      It waits on the playViewUpdateLOCK queue if it is empty. Each new element added to the queue wakes up the thread.

    • placedCardsLocal

      Map<String,LinkedHashMap<Point,PlayableCard>> placedCardsLocal

    • print_PlacedCards

      private StringBuilder print_PlacedCards(LinkedHashMap<Point,PlayableCard> placedCards)
      Returns a stringBuilder that allows you to print a PlayArea in the playArea section of the tui. The cards are printed following the order of insertion on the map and positioned based on the point. PlaceHolders are printed before the cards to show the player the points in which he can play a card
      Parameters:
      placedCards - a LinkedHashMap of Point and PlayableCard representing the placed cards on the play area
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder containing the printed representation of the placed cards

    • print_ObjectiveCard

      protected StringBuilder print_ObjectiveCard(ObjectiveCard card, int relative_x, int relative_y, int overFlowUp, int overFlowDown, int overFlowLeft, int overFlowRight)
      Returns a stringBuilder that allows you to print a ObjectiveCard on tui, in a certain position in a delimited area. The card is printed starting from the top left corner of the card. (relative_x,relative_y) = (0,0) corresponds to the top left corner of the area where the card is printed.

      The card is made of n strings of length m, where n is equals to CARD_HEIGHT and m is equals to CARD_LENGTH. If a character of the strings that composes the card goes outside the limits it is not printed.

      Parameters:
      card - The objective card to be printed.
      relative_x - The relative x position of the card on the screen.
      relative_y - The relative y position of the card on the screen.
      overFlowUp - The upper limit of overflow on the screen.
      overFlowDown - The lower limit of overflow on the screen.
      overFlowLeft - The left limit of overflow on the screen.
      overFlowRight - The right limit of overflow on the screen.
      Returns:
      StringBuilder The result of the printing operation in the form of a string builder. Returns null if the card exceeds the limits of the playArea.

    • print_PlayableCard

      protected StringBuilder print_PlayableCard(PlayableCard card, int relative_x, int relative_y, int overFlowUp, int overFlowDown, int overFlowLeft, int overFlowRight)
      Returns a stringBuilder that allows you to print a PlayableCard on tui, in a certain position in a delimited area. The card is printed starting from the top left corner of the card. (relative_x,relative_y) = (0,0) corresponds to the top left corner of the area where the card is printed.

      The card is made of n strings of length m, where n is equals to CARD_HEIGHT and m is equals to CARD_LENGTH. If a character of the strings that composes the card goes outside the limits it is not printed.

      Parameters:
      card - The playable card to be printed.
      relative_x - The x-coordinate of the top left corner of the card relative to the play area.
      relative_y - The y-coordinate of the top left corner of the card relative to the play area.
      overFlowUp - The upper overflow limit of the play area.
      overFlowDown - The lower overflow limit of the play area.
      overFlowLeft - The left overflow limit of the play area.
      overFlowRight - The right overflow limit of the play area.
      Returns:
      A StringBuilder containing the generated ANSI escape sequences to print the card on the console.

      initial_col - the column where the deck area starts
      end_row - the row where the deck area ends
      end_col - the column where the deck area ends
      Returns:

    • execute_command

      private void execute_command(String command)
      This method searches for the command in the state's commands map and executes it.

      Corner cases:

      • If the command is wrong, it execute TUIstate.command_invalidCommand()
      • If the command is empty, it execute TUIstate.command_showCommandsInfo() and TUIstate.stateNotify()
      • If the command is TUIstateCommands.NOTIFY, it execute TUIstate.stateNotify()
      • If the command is TUIstateCommands.RECONNECT, it execute TUIstate.reconnect()
      Parameters:
      command -

    • commandToProcess

      protected void commandToProcess(TUIstateCommands cmd, boolean stateNotify)
      Sends the corresponding TUIcommand to be executed to the ProcessThread and notify the commands queue. It sends the commands by adding them to the cmdLineMessagesLOCK queue.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The TUI command to process.
      stateNotify - A boolean indicating whether to call TUIstate.stateNotify() or not.

    • show_heartBeat

      public void show_heartBeat()
      This method is called each time the server receives the heart beat from the client.

      If the heart beat is not received and not already printed, it prints the heart beat received status and updates the HBprinted boolean. Then it updates the heartBeatReceived boolean to true.

    • updateCmdLineOut

      private void updateCmdLineOut()
      This method is used to update the command line output messages.

      It prints the messages in the right position of the console.

      It also manages the queue of the messages.

      private Thread chatBoardThreadBuilder()
      The chatBoardThread is not active in all the states. When interrupted the Thread variable is set to null.

      This method is used to rebuild the chat board thread to start it again.

      Returns:

    • show_chatMessage

      public void show_chatMessage(String username, String message)
      Update the chatMessages queue and notify the chatBoardThread to print the messages. The notify is done through the chatNeedsUpdateLOCK object.

      It also notifies the statusBarTHREAD to print the chat notification if needed.

      This method is invoked by the NewChatMessage All the parameters are provided by the GameController

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the client that sent the message
      message - the message sent

    • show_privateChatMessage

      public void show_privateChatMessage(String fromUsername, String toUsername, String message)
      Update the chatMessages queue with a private message only if the message is for the client or from the client. Notify the chatBoardThread to print the messages. The notify is done through the chatNeedsUpdateLOCK object.

      It also notifies the statusBarTHREAD to print the chat notification if needed.

      This method is invoked by the NewChatMessage All the parameters are provided by the GameController

      Parameters:
      fromUsername - the username of the client that sent the message
      toUsername - the username of the client the message is sent to
      message - the message sent

    • runUI

      public void runUI()
      Starts the TUI: prints the title of the game and then runs in this order the following threads:
      • chatReaderTHREAD
      • playViewTHREAD
      • statusBarTHREAD
      • timerTHREAD
      • cmdLineOutTHREAD
      Specified by:
      runUI in class UI

    • show_listGame

      public void show_listGame(List<String> listGame)

      This method is called by the ShowGamesObj object

      Unblock the tui sending the command TUIstateCommands.NOTIFY to che cmdLineProcessTHREAD

      Parameters:
      listGame - the list of available games provided by the Controller

    • show_playArea

      public void show_playArea(String username, LinkedHashMap<Point,PlayableCard> playArea, Map<Resources,Integer> achievedResources)
      Receives the play areas and the achieved resources of all the players, selects the correct ones checking the activePlayArea and creates the corresponding StringBuilder. Then sends the StringBuilder to the playViewTHREAD adding it to the playViewUpdateLOCK queue. It calls notify on the playViewUpdateLOCK queue to print the new play view updates. Also updates the corresponding areasCache with the new play area.

      This method is called by the ShowPlayAreaObj

      All the parameters are provided by the GameController

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      playArea - all the play areas of the players
      achievedResources - the achieved resources of each player

    • show_scorePlayer

      public void show_scorePlayer(LinkedHashMap<String,javafx.util.Pair<Integer,Boolean>> scores)
      Receives the score of all the players, constructs the corresponding StringBuilder and sends it to the playViewTHREAD adding it to the playViewUpdateLOCK queue. Calls notify on the playViewUpdateLOCK queue to print the new play view updates. updates the corresponding areasCache with the new score.

      This method is called by the ShowScorePlayerObj

      All the parameters are provided by the GameController

    • update_ToPlayingState

      public void update_ToPlayingState()
      Updates the TUIstate state to the PlayingState and sends the command TUIstateCommands.SHOW_COMMAND_INFO to the cmdLineProcessTHREAD to show the available commands.

      This method is called by the StartGameObj sent by the GameController.checkReady().

      The flow that triggers this method starts from the JoinedToGameState.command_ready() that calls the TUIstate.stateNotify() so the TUI is already unblocked.

    • show_goldDeck

      public void show_goldDeck(PlayableCard firstCardDeck, PlayableCard card1, PlayableCard card2)

Calls notify on the playViewUpdateLOCK queue to print the new play view updates. updates the corresponding areasCache with the new decks.

      This method is called by the ShowGoldDeckObj

      All the parameters are provided by the GameController

      Parameters:

      card1 - the first gold card shown to the players
      card2 - the second gold card shown to the players

Calls notify on the playViewUpdateLOCK queue to print the new play view updates. updates the corresponding areasCache with the new decks.

      This method is called by the ShowResourceDeckObj

      All the parameters are provided by the GameController

      card1 - the first resource card shown to the players
      card2 - the second resource card shown to the players

    • show_handPlayer

      public void show_handPlayer(String username, List<PlayableCard> hand, int selectedCard)
      Receives the username of the player, its hand and the index of the selected card. If the username is the same as the client's username: constructs the corresponding StringBuilder and sends it to the playViewTHREAD adding it to the playViewUpdateLOCK queue; calls notify on the playViewUpdateLOCK queue to print the new play view updates; updates the corresponding areasCache with the new hand.

      This method is called by the ShowHandPlayerObj

      All the parameters are provided by the GameController

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      hand - the hand of the player
      selectedCard - the index of the selected card

    • show_objectiveCard

      public void show_objectiveCard(String username, ObjectiveCard objectiveCard)
      Receives the username of the player and the objective card. If the username is the same as the client's username: constructs the corresponding StringBuilder and sends it to the playViewTHREAD adding it to the playViewUpdateLOCK queue; calls notify on the playViewUpdateLOCK queue to print the new play view updates; updates the corresponding areasCache with the new personal objective card.

      This method is called by the ShowSecretObjectiveCardObj

      All the parameters are provided by the GameController

      Parameters:

      objectiveCard - the objective card

    • show_chooseObjectiveCard

      public void show_chooseObjectiveCard(String username, ObjectiveCard objectiveCard1, ObjectiveCard objectiveCard2)
      Receives the username of the player and the two personal objective card alternatives. If the username is the same as the client's username: t constructs the corresponding StringBuilder and sends it to the playViewTHREAD adding it to the playViewUpdateLOCK queue; calls notify on the playViewUpdateLOCK queue to print the new play view updates; updates the corresponding areasCache with the new personal objective card alternatives.

      All the parameters are provided by the GameController

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      objectiveCard1 - the first objective card
      objectiveCard2 - the second objective card

    • show_commonObjectiveCard

      public void show_commonObjectiveCard(ObjectiveCard card1, ObjectiveCard card2)
      Receives the two common objective cards. Constructs the corresponding StringBuilder; sends it to the playViewTHREAD adding it to the playViewUpdateLOCK queue; calls notify on the playViewUpdateLOCK queue to print the new play view updates; updates the corresponding areasCache with the new common objective cards.

      This method is called by the ShowCommonObjectiveCardObj

      All the parameters are provided by the GameController

      Parameters:
      card1 - the first common objective card
      card2 - the second common objective card

    • show_starterCard

      public void show_starterCard(String username, PlayableCard starterCard)
      Receives the username of the player and the starter card. If the username is the same as the client's username: constructs the corresponding StringBuilder and sends it to the playViewTHREAD adding it to the playViewUpdateLOCK queue; calls notify on the playViewUpdateLOCK queue to print the new play view updates; updates the corresponding areasCache with the new starter card.

      This method is called by the ShowStarterCardObj

      All the parameters are provided by the GameController

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      starterCard - the starter card

    • show_validUsername

      public void show_validUsername(String username)
      Receives the accepter username of the player, prints the response message to the command line out and set the client's username with the accepted username. It also sets the activePlayArea with the accepted username.

      This method is called by the ValidUsernameObj

      All the parameters are provided by the Controller

      Parameters:
      username - the accepted username

    • show_wrongUsername

      public void show_wrongUsername(String username)
      Receives the username of the player, prints the response message to the command line out. Recall the TUIstate.setUsername() to let the client insert a new name.

      This method is called by the WrongUsernameObj

      All the parameters are provided by the Controller

      Parameters:
      username - the wrong username

    • show_joinedToGame

      public void show_joinedToGame(int id, int maxNumberOfPlayers)
      Prints the game the client joined to and its id to the command line out. Starts the chatBoardThread. Updates the state to the JoinedToGameState. Sends the command TUIstateCommands.SHOW_COMMAND_INFO to the cmdLineProcessTHREAD to show the available commands.

      This method is called by the JoinedToGameObj

      All the parameters are provided by the Controller

      Parameters:
      id - the id of the game the client joined to
      maxNumberOfPlayers - the maximum number of players of the game

    • show_quitFromGame

      public void show_quitFromGame()
      Change the state to the InitState. Interrupts the chatBoardThread. Clears the chatMessages queue. Sends the command TUIstateCommands.SHOW_COMMAND_INFO to the cmdLineProcessTHREAD to show the available commands. Clears the areasCache. Sends the command TUIstateCommands.REFRESH to the cmdLineProcessTHREAD to refresh the TUI. Prints the quit message to the command line out.

      This method is called by the QuitFromGameRObj

    • show_gameIsFull

      public void show_gameIsFull(int id)
      Prints the message to the command line out. Sends the command TUIstateCommands.NOTIFY to the cmdLineProcessTHREAD to unblock the TUI.

      This method is called by the GameIsFullObj

      All the parameters are provided by the Controller

      Parameters:
      id - the id of the game that is full

    • show_gameCreated

      public void show_gameCreated(int gameID)

      This method is called by the GameCreatedObj

      All the parameters are provided by the Controller

      Parameters:
      gameID - the id of the game created

    • receiveToken

      public void receiveToken(int token, boolean temporary)
      Receives the token to set to the client and a boolean to indicates if the token is temporary or must be saved. Calls the ClientCommands.setToken(int, boolean) e} to set the token.

      This method is called by the SaveTokenObj

      All the parameters are provided by the Controller

      Parameters:
      token - the token to set to the client
      temporary - a boolean to indicates if the token is temporary or must be saved

    • show_wantReconnect

      public void show_wantReconnect(String username)
      Receives the username of the player. Set the client username with the received username. Updates the activePlayArea with the received username. Sends the TUIstateCommands.RECONNECT command to the cmdLineProcessTHREAD.

      This method is called by the WantsReconnectObj

      The parameter is provided by the Controller

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player

    • show_rejoined

      public void show_rejoined(boolean result, List<String> players)
      Receives the result of the rejoin request and a list with the players in the game. If the result is true, starts the chatBoardThread. Updates the state to the PlayingState. Sends the TUIstateCommands.SHOW_COMMAND_INFO command to the cmdLineProcessTHREAD to show the available commands. If the result is false, sets the client token with the default token and sends the TUIstateCommands.SET_USERNAME command to the cmdLineProcessTHREAD to allow the client to insert a new username.

      This method is called by the ReJoinedObj

      All the parameters are provided by the Controller

      Parameters:
      result - the result of the rejoin request
      players - a list with the players in the game

    • show_unableToReconnect

      public void show_unableToReconnect()
      Prints the message to the command line out. Sets the client token with the default token. Sends the TUIstateCommands.SET_USERNAME command to the cmdLineProcessTHREAD to allow the client to insert a new username. This method is called when the client has a token saved locally that do not correspond to a disconnected user on the server side.

      This method is called by the WrongUsernameObj constructed with a null username.

    • show_timerLastPlayerConnected

      public void show_timerLastPlayerConnected(Integer secondsLeft)
      Receives the seconds left to the start of the game. Constructs the corresponding StringBuilder and sends it to the playViewTHREAD adding it to the playViewUpdateLOCK queue. Calls notify on the playViewUpdateLOCK queue to print the new play view updates.

      This method is called by the TimerLastPlayerConnectedObj

      All the parameters are provided by the GameController

      Parameters:
      secondsLeft - the seconds left to the start of the game
